text: Robert "Bob" Allen Williams (January 2, 1930 â€“ May 26, 2016) was an American football quarterback in the National Football League. He was born in Cumberland, Maryland. Williams played for the Chicago Bears from 1951 through 1952 and again in 1955. During his college years, he played for the Notre Dame Fighting Irish team. Williams was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 1988. Williams died on May 26, 2016 at a retirement home in Timonium, Maryland from Parkinson's disease, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== *NFL.com player page Category:1930 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in Maryland Category:Chicago Bears players Category:Sportspeople from Maryland
title: Bob Williams (quarterback)
